Name: Great Pyramid of Giza
Details: The oldest and only surviving wonder of the original Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, built as a tomb for the Egyptian Pharaoh Khufu.

Name: Hanging Gardens of Babylon
Details: A legendary terraced garden, described as an extraordinary feat of engineering with an ascending series of tiered gardens containing a wide variety of trees, shrubs, and vines.

Name: Statue of Zeus at Olympia
Details: A giant seated figure of Zeus, about 12 meters tall, made by the sculptor Phidias around 435 BCE.

Name: Temple of Artemis at Ephesus
Details: A large temple dedicated to the goddess Artemis, completed around 550 BCE, known for its grandeur and artistic beauty.

Name: Mausoleum at Halicarnassus
Details: A tomb built for Mausolus, a satrap of the Persian Empire, and his wife Artemisia, around 350 BCE. It stood approximately 45 meters tall.

Name: Colossus of Rhodes
Details: A giant statue of the sun god Helios, erected in the city of Rhodes around 280 BCE. It stood approximately 33 meters high.

Name: Lighthouse of Alexandria (Pharos of Alexandria)
Details: A towering lighthouse built by the Ptolemaic Kingdom between 280 and 247 BCE on the island of Pharos. It was estimated to be at least 100 meters tall.

Name: Great Wall of China
Details: A series of fortifications made of stone, brick, tamped earth, wood, and other materials, built along the northern borders of China to protect against invasions.

Name: Petra
Details: An archaeological city famous for its rock-cut architecture and water conduit system, established as early as 312 BCE.

Name: Christ the Redeemer
Details: An iconic statue of Jesus Christ, standing 30 meters tall, located at the peak of the 700-meter Corcovado mountain.

Name: Machu Picchu
Details: An Incan citadel set high in the Andes Mountains, built in the 15th century and later abandoned.

Name: Chichen Itza
Details: A large pre-Columbian archaeological site built by the Maya civilization, famous for its stepped pyramids, temples, and ball courts.

Name: Roman Colosseum
Details: An ancient amphitheater built between 70-80 AD, known for hosting gladiatorial contests and public spectacles.

Name: Taj Mahal
Details: A white marble mausoleum built by the Mughal Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his favorite wife, Mumtaz Mahal, completed in 1653.

Name: Grand Canyon
Details: A steep-sided canyon carved by the Colorado River, known for its visually overwhelming size and intricate and colorful landscape.

Name: Great Barrier Reef
Details: The world's largest coral reef system, composed of over 2,900 individual reefs and 900 islands stretching over 2,300 kilometers.

Name: Harbor of Rio de Janeiro
Details: Known as Guanabara Bay, it is surrounded by scenic mountains and famous for its stunning views.

Name: Mount Everest
Details: Earth's highest mountain above sea level, standing at 8,848 meters (29,029 feet).

Name: Aurora Borealis (Northern Lights)
Details: Natural light displays predominantly seen in high-latitude regions around the Arctic and Antarctic.

Name: Victoria Falls
Details: One of the largest and most famous waterfalls in the world, with a width of 1,708 meters and a height of 108 meters.

Name: Parícutin Volcano
Details: A cinder cone volcano that erupted in a farmer's field in 1943 and continued to erupt for nine years, growing to a height of 424 meters.
